T1036.002::[Ferocious Kitten] has used right-to-left override to reverse executables’ names to make them appear to have different file extensions, rather than their real ones.
T1036.005::[Ferocious Kitten] has named malicious files update.exe and loaded them into the compromise host's “Public” folder.
T1204.002::[Ferocious Kitten] has attempted to convince victims to enable malicious content within a spearphishing email by including an odd decoy message.
T1566.001::[Ferocious Kitten] has conducted spearphishing campaigns containing malicious documents to lure victims to open the attachments.
T1583.001::[Ferocious Kitten] has acquired domains imitating legitimate sites.
T1588.002::[Ferocious Kitten] has obtained open source tools for its operations, including JsonCPP and Psiphon.
